channel.title: Azure DevOps on BartekR
channel.description: Recent content in Azure DevOps on BartekR

item.title: Using the system OAuth token in Azure DevOps
item.description: One of the new YAML pipeline steps I prepared recently involved interaction with work items. I wanted to add the comments to the task (with the task ID extracted from some file). So, I created a PowerShell step that was executing Invoke-WebRequest (with try/catch logic, obviously), the process finished successfully, but nothing happened. I mean - the comments were not there. Uhmmmm, why?! The log analysis gave me a slight hint about what was wrong (as seen in the post header picture):

item.title: Adding a new task in TFS (Azure DevOps) using Excel
item.description: In the previous post, I added the tasks to on-premises TFS using C#. This time I will add similar data using an Excel add-in. I will also learn how to accidentally remove the link from the task to the parent element. First things first - if you do not have Azure DevOps OfficeÂ® Integration 2019 installed (you need it to work with TFS / Azure DevOps from Excel), then go to https://visualstudio.
